{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3228946,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-02T05:31:49.791Z","cooked":"

We have recently been working on an A* path planning script for use in FRC, and we wanted to be able to visualize the current path that has been calculated in FRC Web Components.
Basically, how would we overlay a line on top of the field image that follows a given set of points?
How would we go about doing this?

GitHub

GitHub - lasarobotics/PurplePath: FRC Path Finding

FRC Path Finding. Contribute to lasarobotics/PurplePath development by creating an account on GitHub.

I would recommend just doing this in AdvantageScope. You can very easily graph WPILib Field 2D objects and view them as trajectories.

github.com

Mechanical-Advantage/AdvantageScope/blob/main/docs/tabs/ODOMETRY.md

# üó∫ Odometry

_[< Return to homepage](/docs/INDEX.md)_

The odometry tab shows a 2D visualization of the robot overlayed on a map of the field. It can also show extra data like vision targeting status and reference poses. The timeline shows when the robot is enabled and can be used to navigate through the log data.

> Note: To view the odometry visualization alongside other tabs, click the "Add Window" icon just below the navigation/playback controls.

![Overview of odometry tab](/docs/resources/odometry/odometry-1.png)

## Pose Data

To add a field with pose data, drag it from the sidebar to the box under "Poses" and use the drop down to select an object type. Multiple sets of objects can be added this way, and fields can be included multiple times. To remove a set of objects, right-click the field name under "Poses".

All pose data must be stored as a numeric array describing one or more 2D poses with the following format:

```
[
  x, y, rot,
  x, y, rot,

But can I easily view that live? I want the visualization to be seen live during a match, along with any other indicators/data on the dashboard.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-09-02T05:51:40.153Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":180,"readers_count":179,"score":41.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":440410,"topic_slug":"visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19120,"username":"saikiranra","name":"Saikiran Ramanan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/saikiranra/{size}/195798_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components/440410/3","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3228952,"name":"Saikiran Ramanan","username":"saikiranra","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/saikiranra/{size}/195798_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-02T06:28:23.544Z","cooked":"

You can look at it live during testing. Needing to see the path live during a match does not generally seem practical.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-09-02T06:28:23.544Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":54.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":440410,"topic_slug":"visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components","display_username":"Saikiran Ramanan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19120,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components/440410/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3228953,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-02T06:36:21.009Z","cooked":"

I want to disagree, the operator could glance down at the display and know if the path produced is good or nonsensical, and let the driver know, ‚Äúhey, don‚Äôt use the auto drive function right now‚Äù.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-09-02T06:36:21.009Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":39.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":440410,"topic_slug":"visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19120,"username":"saikiranra","name":"Saikiran Ramanan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/saikiranra/{size}/195798_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components/440410/5","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3228958,"name":"Jonah Bonner","username":"jonahb55","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-02T11:34:56.848Z","cooked":"

To be a little blunt, I think that if you can‚Äôt trust that the path will always be right it‚Äôs really not a feature that‚Äôs ready to be used on the field. If the point is to make things easier/smoother/faster for the driver then they need to be able to trust it.

If the point is just to gather data at an offseason without really worrying about the competitive aspect, I imagine a log file would be more useful anyway. But I hope that you find a tool that does what you‚Äôre looking for regardless.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-09-02T11:34:56.848Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":155,"readers_count":154,"score":126.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":440410,"topic_slug":"visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components","display_username":"Jonah Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44471,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328M/WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components/440410/6","custom_user_title":"6328M/WPILib","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3228966,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-02T13:13:03.967Z","cooked":"

It could also be not necessarily a bad path but one that goes through a robot, that isn‚Äôt in the field graph.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-09-02T13:13:03.967Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":149,"readers_count":148,"score":44.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":440410,"topic_slug":"visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44471,"username":"jonahb55","name":"Jonah Bonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonahb55/{size}/194474_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components/440410/7","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3228967,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-02T13:45:01.009Z","cooked":"

Why not a button to pause the path until a robot clears out of the way? It should be pretty easy to notice an oncoming collision.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-09-02T13:45:01.009Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":32.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":440410,"topic_slug":"visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components/440410/8","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3228989,"name":"Saikiran Ramanan","username":"saikiranra","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/saikiranra/{size}/195798_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-02T17:35:03.093Z","cooked":"

The loop between generating the path, having the operator understand the path and the real environment, and the operator approving the path seems like it would be on the order of magnitude of a few seconds. I would recommend descoping the usage to areas where you know there is minimal intervention (scoring action or double sub pickup when in loading zone).

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2023-09-02T17:35:03.093Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":126,"readers_count":125,"score":25.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":440410,"topic_slug":"visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components","display_username":"Saikiran Ramanan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19120,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/visualize-paths-in-frc-web-components/440410/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3229238,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2023-09-04T01:57:02.884Z","cooked":"

What if I just wanted the live visualisation to look cool?

Yeah, the way I see it being used is the driver has to hold a button down to execute, and if there‚Äôs something unexpected in the way, the driver releases said button, and the robot returns to driver control.

Are you using the dashboard app or creating a custom dashboard? If you‚Äôre using the app the field component automatically shows trajectories that you‚Äôve added in your robot code:

image1920√ó986 81.7 KB
